data.title: Sushi stop in San Antonio
data.text: I had Tokyo Yokisoba and my wife had a Salmon roll and a Shrimp one. Quick and efficient service and the edamame was seasoned just right.

data.title: Awesome sushi!!
data.text: We came to my nephews Air Force training graduation for the week and decided we wanted to eat sushi. Did a little research and TripAdvisor gave this location high ratings....it's only right I add to it. We couldn't decide on the rolls we wanted to our waitress suggested an emperor's platter....that's truly a way to describe this awesome selection of sushi. It was 68 pieces of sushi and among the 4 of us we couldn't believe we inhaled every piece!!! If you love sushi this is definitely your place!!

data.title: Great sushi
data.text: I am not a sushi expert but I ordered the sampler and it can with a Philadelphia roll.  You can actually choose which roll you want.  The food was great!  The service was ok,  only ok.  I will return here next trip

data.title: best Sushi in San Antonio
data.text: Been coming to this place for a few years and the quality just keeps getting better and better. amazing service

data.title: Sushi happy hour was great-waitress should loose the attitude
data.text: The sushi here is good, and sushi happy hour is a bargain. I almost walked out with the waitress giving me continued attitude all night....she was obnoxious and rude. Didn't even bring soy sauce out to my table and wondered why I sat there waiting....

data.title: Great Sushi
data.text: The food is super  but but the price is a little high. Great  location and atmosphere.    It is  within walking  distance of most  of the hotels downtown and half a block from the Riverwalk.

data.title: Great Japanese restaurant in the center of the city
data.text: Lay back atmosphere, can go with or without reservation. Loved the sushi, maki sand soups. Fresh and tasty! Will return!

data.title: It Was Average...
data.text: Nice little sushi spot. I can tell it's popular. My coworker and I went right at 11am. It started the fill up by the time we left. Food was average. Too many menu options.

data.title: Best Sushi restaurant in SA, hands down
data.text: Best Sushi restaurant in SA, hands down, best variety, best prices, great happy hour, I could eat here every day

data.title: Delightful Dinner
data.text: We tried several different rolls and had the Mango Sherbet for dessert - very refreshing.  The Stone Oak Roll was our favorite of the night.

data.title: Top Shelf!
data.text: Wonderful food! Rice less sushi rolls for gluten restricted diets! Service was decent tends to be a it slow when busy but well worth the wait! Very clean and modern atmosphere! Price was medium range.

data.title: Great prices
data.text: We chose to eat here because it was literally the only sushi place anywhere near the river walk where we were staying. The sushi was good, service and atmosphere were less than average but the prices are unbeatable. Less than $75 for two hungry adults to fill up on sashimi and rolls.

data.title: First Time Visit: Average Sushi
data.text:
We visited last Sunday for lunch after staying at a hotel on Riverwalk nearby.  We wanted a light lunch before driving back home.

Atmosphere was ordinary, nothing special, especially being downtown. My wife and I were  surprised how plain it was. 

We always see Zushi Sushi advertised, especially on those displays at hotels with all the brochures for local attractions and restaurants. We frequent S.A. a lot and always wanted to try one of their locations.

Service was okay.  We had a rainbow roll, a tempura style Philidelphia roll, and a chicken udon noodle dish. The tempura style Philly roll was lightly cooked and not oily. Ive made Philly rolls at home tempura style and I prefer mine.  The Rainbow roll was average compared to other sushi bars I have eaten at. 

The chicken udon noodle dish was super salty, and I rarely complain about salty food. Chicken was cooked very tender and had good texture, but the sauce killed it.

Again, it wasn't a bad lunch, but not great amd we felt like we wasted our time and money, when we could have spent it at a place with better atmosphere and better food.

I probably won't try their other locations. 

2 out of 5 stars.

owner_response.author: Sushizushi, Manager at Sushi Zushi, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking your time to comment on your dining experience and your honest feedback. We continually try to do our very best for all of our guests, but unfortunately, sometimes we do fail. 
I will look into each issue that you have noted, in an attempt to correct and improve our service and food quality.
Meanwhile, I would like to invite you to contact me personally at szmarketing@sushizushi.com to discuss with you further on the issues.
We appreciate your business, and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Sincerely,
S Yim
Sushi Zushi of Texas, LLC
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awesome
data.text: We had the Bento box lunches. The miso was delicious. The chicken skewer was nicely bbq'd. The fish was tasty and fresh😊

data.title: Downtown sushi
data.text: Kids wanted sushi for dinner.  We were near town so I looked up suggestions using trip advisor.  Sushi zushi came up. We have gone to sushi zushi many times in stone oak and like eating there.  We decided to try it.  It was excellent.  The restaurant is much smaller than the one in stone oak and located In a small corner near the Riverwalk.  But the sushi is just as good, and they have the same menu selection as sushi zushi in stone oak.  The sushi is fresh and their rice dishes were delicious.  The servers are nice and helpful.  Overall we really enjoyed it.  The only downside is the parking.  Naturally, if you are downtown, it can be a challenge.  There is parking nearby, but be prepared to pay.  If you happen to be downtown already, and want some good sushi though, this place will fit the bill perfectly.

data.title: I am there everyday
data.text: Jeff the Kitchen Manager is on top of Fresh Products and giving that extra effort to make a great experience each guest.

data.title: Yummyum
data.text: Nice clean, helpful staff. The servers are knowledgable about the food they are serving, pretty good variety. Fun to watch

data.title: Good happy hour prices and decent sushi
data.text: This was a pleasant discovery for happy hour one late afternoon whilst wandering the streets and riverwalk.  Friendly staff, reasonably priced drinks and good deals on sushi were the highlights.  It did seem like the sushi chefs who were in for happy hour were somewhat less experienced as the rolls were not the most tightly rolled nor prettiest I have ever had, but the food was good and I would definitely go back again.

data.title: Average but fresh Sushi
data.text: Not one of my top 5 simply because of their prices. However I will say they have an extensive menu and so far the sushi has been fresh. Not as flavorable on some of the rolls as I would expect but I like spicy. I used their delivery a couple times before but this particular time was longer than expected.

data.title: Good Sushi
data.text: This place was recommended by a hotel staff member at our hotel. It was a bit pricey but it was good.
